description.narrative: 6.3. By 2021, the government, partners and communities have increased capacity to provide birth registration services for children under five at national and subnational levels.,which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 6. By 2021, children benefit from a system that ensures integrated, improved and equitable prevention of and response to violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect.

sector.narrative: Birth Registration/Civil Registration and Vital Statistics systems
Justice, birth registration/CRVS, and alternative care - planning, co-ordination and programme monitoring
Justice, birth registration/CRVS, and alternative care - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 6.3. By 2021, the government, partners and communities have increased capacity to provide birth registration services for children under five at national and subnational levels.

description.narrative: UNICEF support focussed on strengthening the role of the health sector in birth registration given the 2018 DHS which revealed that 84% of births in Zambia occur in health facilities. This includes electronic birth registration systems in health facilities as well as the development of birth registration guidelines for health workers, which is in line with priorities identified in the finalised birth registration evaluation and management response. UNICEF is also working with other UN Agencies to support government on a holistic approach for civil registration and identity management through the UN Legal Identity Agenda | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Percentage of districts that have a free and universal birth registration service within the civil registration (in accordance with national legal requirements)
C4D strategy to address public and officials

target.value: 2021:Scale up to 4 more Provinces for C4D interventions developed and implementation started

actual.value: 2020:Roll-out of the National Advocacy and Communication Strategy- development of birth registration content messaging for radio, TV, social media and IEC materials.

title.narrative: National budget allocated for birth registration increased

target.value: 2021:Civil/Birth registration budgetary allocation and disbursements in line with the national CRVS strategic plan

title.narrative: Existence of a national civil registration and vital statistics strategy(ies) which reflects recent international standards and principles for CRVS systems and are in line with the human rights conventions and protocols ratified by the State

actual.value: 2020:806 heath facilities with birth registration services and BR Guidelines for health workers. 8 provinces with functional printing centres
